docna.cdata!:
Nepal - Kathmandu Tourism Project : Credit
            0291 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Nepal - Kathmandu Tourism Project
            : Credit 0291 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
Kathmandu is the main center for foreign
            tourists and the only place where hotels are up to
            international standards. Of the 558 hotel rooms which meet
            the Department of Tourism's standards, 500 are in
            Kathmandu. The proposed project would add 271 rooms, which
            it is estimated would provide accommodation for some 34,000
            additional tourists per year. The project is made up of two
            sub-projects, the extension and refurbishing of the existing
            Hotel de l'Annapurna; and the construction of a new
            hotel, to be called the Yak and Yeti Hotel. The project is
            expected to be completed by the end of 1974. The credit
            would cover 64 percent of the total financing.
